Track Metrics

  • Docs
  • Guides
  • Getting Started
  • Track Metrics

Tracking metrics has never been easier than using the Overview page! You can dynamically filter data based on category, date ranges, and periods.

This allows you to interact with your data in new ways. When data is entered into Expense Tracker, it is stored at the most granular level. This allows the data to later be sliced and filtered in many different ways.

Categories Section

The category section allows you to filter on a given category. To open the filter for this category, click the filter icon in the upper-left corner of the section.

This list of category names is dynamically updated when a category is updated, a new category is added, an expense is updated, or a new expense is added. By default, 'All Categories' will be selected but multiple categories can be added. If all categories are removed from the filter and it is left empty, it will show 'All Categories'.

Expenses Section

The expenses section allows you to filter on a given category, date range, or period. To open the filter for this category, click the filter icon in the upper-left corner of the section.

This list of category names is dynamically updated when a category is updated, a new category is added, an expense is updated, or a new expense is added. By default, 'All Categories' will be selected but multiple categories can be added. If all categories are removed from the filter and it is left empty, it will show 'All Categories'.

The date range by default is set to this week. This can be changed to weekly, monthly, yearly, or custom. When choosing custom, a start and end date will need to be defined.

Category Breakdown Section

The category breakdown section allows you to filter on a given category by toggling it from the chart's legend. Additionally, you can filter on a date range or period as well as define the date units.

The date units will modify the x-axis to the defined unit. For example, if you select 'Months' it will show the expenses for each month of the defined date range. By default, the date units is set to 'Days'.

This chart also lets you modify the date range. By default, this range is set to this week. This can be changed to weekly, monthly, yearly, or custom. When choosing custom, a start and end date will need to be defined.
